TopicTitle: KSP free PC copy for owners of Enhanced Edition?

Articles.Content:
So today I was casually playing on my PS4 and I was making a VTOL with harrier-like nozzles. It didn't work, but I got interrupted by SEVERAL bugs. First was: "Auto-saved craft being loaded" second, "vessel doesn't get fully loaded" and the last one: GAME CRASHING.

So that's why I think of moving to the PC/Laptop version. Does anyone know If there's a way for me to get a free copy of it?

6 minutes ago, Aerodynamic Kerbal said:

So that's why I think of moving to the PC/Laptop version. Does anyone know If there's a way for me to get a free copy of it?

The only way it know is [REDACTED] but asides from that, the lowest price you can get it at is 30 dollars on Steam when it's on sale for the game and both DLC's.

Unfortunately, no. You will have to buy it separately. 

Also, if you buy it, just get Complete Edition. I got the base game and now I wish I had got the full game..

AFAIK, there is no rebate program for console users, and vice versa.   But KSP frequently goes on sale, we kind of keep a running tab on where it's on sale, but there's links in this thread to all sites that sell KSP:

It can frequently be found for under $10.   Just keep your eye out.

Nah, that's just in general unrealistic thing for game studios. You have to wait for a sale or go for a full-price copy of the product. Unfortunately for gamers, different platforms mean different game copies
